intro: Micronychia minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf starflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its tiny, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink, typically in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, arranged alternately along the stems. Micronychia minutiflora thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and small floral displays.
